PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Reported Incident - Requesting JDA access for CMI planner
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: Prerequisite is required approval in ""mypassport.walgreens.com"" from assigned manager.  Application team need to take business approval and then provide access (KBA00057869)
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. For user access request, verify if the necessary details are provided by user if not ask user to provide the same.
2. After the necessary details are received, mail business to seek approval to grant access.
3. Once approval is received, login to UI and provide access for user.
4. Send mail to user mentioning that access is provided and ask user to validate and confirm.
5. Once user confirm access is working then resolve the ticket

Incident Reported (In Remedy): Inventory (RxI) - Any Problem with Auto Replenishment
PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store Reported Excessive ordering issue (Demand Planner Issue)
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: After reviewing the OH Inventory, emailed planner with ordering parameters to review the issue and adjust the ordering parameters. This will be worked upon by the planner and issue will be resolved soon after the planner takes the action. (KBA00058337)
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. For mentioned item and store combination, check the orders generated in database server.
2. Verify if the on hand is in sync with generated orders.
3. Pull the parameter list in databricks with run date as latest order generated date .
4. Calculate the 90 days of sales and compare with on hand then send the parameter list to planners for review if on hand < 90 days of sales.
5. Communicate with store that this is taken care by planners.
Remarks: Issue is same but store raised tickets with different headers hence the resolution steps are same(Demand planner issue)

PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store Reported Excessive ordering issue (OH Inventory)
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: On hand inventory is less than 90-day projections of sales and store should be able to see- through current inventory. No action is required. (KBA00058337)
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. For mentioned item and store combination, verify if there is active sourcing and schedule and check if orders are generated for mentioned items in database server.
2. Verify if the on hand is in sync with generated orders.
3. Pull the parameter list in databricks with run date as latest order generated date .
4. Calculate the 90 days of sales and compare with on hand,here on hand < 90 days of sales
5. Send mail communication to store mentioning that on hand is less than 90 days of sales and store should be able to sell this inventory
Remarks: Issue is same but store raised tickets with different headers hence the resolution steps are same(oh<90 days sales)

Incident Reported (In Remedy): MyInventory App - Any Problem With Auto Ordering
PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store Reported Excessive ordering issue (Orders pushed by planners)
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: As per store's concern we  found that no auto-orders are generated for the mentioned item from JDA end in the past one month. The recent order was pushed by the planner. We are looping the planner in this mail to get further updates. This is now worked by planner. (KBA00058337)
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. Store raised excessive ordering concern, check if there is active sourcing and schedule.
2. Login to database server, check if there are orders suggested for mentioned item store combination.
3. If there are no orders in the above steps , check if there any orders generated in DA orders by planners.
4. Mail the planner who pushed the DA orders and ask them to review the issue 
5. Send mail to store that orders were generated by JDA but pushed from planners end and will be resolved by planners.
Remarks: Issue is same but store raised tickets with different headers hence the resolution steps are same(Orders pushed by planners)

PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store Reported Excessive ordering issue (Pull&Quarantine Issue)
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: Store reported that the item is on Pull & quarantine . After analysis, we have mailed the planner to review and make some adjustments so that the items will stop ordering. This is now worked upon by a planner and will be resolved soon after the planner acts. (KBA00058337)
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. For the mentioned item and store combination, check if there is active sourcing and schedule.
2. In database server check if orders are suggested from JDA end.
3. If there are orders suggested from our end , send mail to respective planner along with parameter list to stop ordering as the item is on pull and Quarantine.
4. Send communication to Store that this taken care by planners.
Remarks: Issue is same but store raised tickets with different headers hence the resolution steps are same(Orders pushed by planners)

Incident Reported (In Remedy): MyInventory App - Any Problem With Auto Ordering
PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store Reported Excessive ordering issue (Sourcing Discontinued)
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: As per store's concern we checked and found for the given item the sourcing has been discontinued at JDA end. No more auto orders will be suggested for this item.  (KBA00058337)
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. Store raised excessive ordering concern, check if there is active sourcing and schedule.
2. Check if the disc > run_date for mentioned item and store combination.
3. As the sourcing is discontinued send mail to store that there will be no orders as sourcing is discontinued for store from source.
Remarks: Issue is same but store raised tickets with different headers hence the resolution steps are same(Sourcing discontinued)

PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store reported Low Ordering (Demand Planner Issue)
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: After checking, emailed planner to review the issue and adjust the ordering parameters (if required). This will be worked upon by the planner and issue will be resolved soon after the planner takes the action. (KBA00074759)

1. Store raised low ordering concern therefore login to databricks and pull parameter list for item store Combination.

Incident Reported (In Remedy): MyInventory App - Any Other Problem With Ordering
PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store Reported missing ordering issue
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: After Analysis as per store's concern, ordering has been turned ON . These will be ordered as per schedule. (KBA00058333)
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. Store raised missing order concern, check if there is active sourcing and schedule for item store combination.
2. Check if planning has been turned off for mentioned opstudies.
2. If it is turned off then send mail to business/planner asking for approval to turn on ordering.
3. Once approval is received from business, turn the ordering on for mentioned opstudies in database.
4. Send mail communication to store that ordering has been turned on and orders will be generated from next ordering schedule.

Incident Reported (In Remedy): MyInventory App - Any Problem With Manual Ordering
PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store Reported missing ordering issue
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: After Analysis team found that for the given item, orders were generating as per schedule and delivered to store. We don't find any issue in the ordering parameters (KBA00058333)
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. For item and store combination, check if active sourcing and schedule is present.
2. In database server check if orders were generated as per schedule.
3. The order history is shared with SAP to check if the suggested orders were delivered at store.
4. After SAP confirmed that orders were delivered, Mail communication sent to store that there is issue with ordering.
Remarks: Issue is same but store raised tickets with different headers hence the resolution steps are same(Missing ordering issue)

Incident Reported (In Remedy): Inventory (RxI) - Any Problem with Auto Replenishment
PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store Reported missing ordering issue
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: After Analysis team found that for the given item, orders were generating as per schedule and delivered to store. We don't find any issue in the ordering parameters. (KBA00058333)
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. For item and store combination, check if active sourcing and schedule is present.
2. In database server check if orders were generated as per schedule.

Incident Reported (In Remedy): MyInventory App - Any Problem With Auto Ordering
PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store reported Missing Ordering issue (Insufficient DC Inventory)
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: After analysis we  found that orders were not transmitted to the store due to the insufficient inventory (Onhand) in the serving warehouse . Once the serving warehouse  is replenished with orders the generated orders will be transmitted to the store. The ordering system generates orders as per demand and replenishment parameters. (KBA00058333)
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. Store raised missing order concern, check if there is active sourcing and schedule for item store combination.
2. Login to database server and check if orders were generated for mentioned item store combination (both constrained and unconstrained)
3. If only unconstrained orders were generated, then check if there is sufficient on hand at DC for the mentioned item.
4. If the DC on hand is very low then make sure there are orders in transit for DC from respective vendor.
5. Communicate with store that orders were generated to store due to insufficient on hand and orders will be generated once DC gets sufficient ON hand.
Remarks: Issue is same but store raised tickets with different headers hence the resolution steps are same(Missing ordering issue - Insufficient DC inventory)

Incident Reported (In Remedy): MyInventory App - Any Problem With Auto Ordering
PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store reported Missing Ordering issue (Slow mover item)
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: After Analysis, we found that, for the mentioned no orders were suggested by the ordering system because these fall in the category of Slow mover items, as they are having annual forecast less than 100 Units and the OH at Store is enough to fulfill the sales demand. Hence, once the inventory falls below the demand the orders will be generated by the ordering system. (KBA00058333)
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. Store raised missing order concern, check if there is active sourcing and schedule for item store combination.
2. Login to database server and check if orders were generated for mentioned item store combination
3. Orders were not suggested by the ordering system because items fall in Slow mover category, as they are having annual forecast less than 100 Units
4. Send mail to store orders were not generated as OH at Store is enough to fulfill the sales demand once the inventory falls below the demand the orders will be generated by the ordering system
Remarks: Issue is same but store raised tickets with different headers hence the resolution steps are same(Missing ordering issue - Slow mover category)

PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store reported Missing Ordering issue (Slow mover item)
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: After Analysis, we found that, for the mentioned no orders were suggested by the ordering system because these fall in the category of Slow mover items, as they are having annual forecast less than 100 Units and the OH at Store is enough to fulfill the sales demand. 3. Orders were not suggested by the ordering system because items fall in Slow mover category, as they are having annual forecast less than 100 Units
4. Send mail to store orders were not generated as OH at Store is enough to fulfill the sales demand once the inventory falls below the demand the orders will be generated by the ordering system
Remarks: Issue is same but store raised tickets with different headers hence the resolution steps are same(Missing ordering issue - Slow mover category)

Incident Reported (In Remedy): MyInventory App - Receiving Excess Inventory or Insufficient Stock
PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store Reported missing ordering issue(Network minimum-Demand planner issue)
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: As per store concern, we found that orders generated for item sourced from Vendor  but the generated order values were less than the network minimum value. The orders were not exported because the network minimum were not met.  We emailed list of parameters for the item. Issue will be resolved as soon as planner takes action (KBA00058333)
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. Store raised missing order concern, check if there is active sourcing and schedule for item store combination.
2. Login to database server and check if orders were generated for mentioned item store combination 
3. There are no orders suggested then check in ordersku table if orders are generated and check the status of the order
4. If the status is 6 then generated order values is less than network minimum value hence orders were not exported.
5. Send mail to planner along with parameter list that orders were not generated due to network minimum issue and take necessary action
6. SEnd mail to store that we have connected with planners and planner will resolve the issue

Incident Reported (In Remedy): MyInventory App - Any Problem With Auto Ordering
PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store Reported missing ordering issue(Turn on/off planning)
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: After Analysis as per store's concern, ordering has been turned ON . These will be ordered as per schedule. (KBA00059487)
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. As per store's concern to turn on ordering, verify if the ordering has been already turned on for mentioned opstudies.
2. If it is not turned on then send mail to business asking for approval to turn on ordering.
3. Once approval is received from business, turn the ordering on for mentioned opstudies in database.
4. Send mail communication to store that ordering has been turned on and orders will be generated from next ordering schedule.

Resolution Categories: Batch Reset With Data Fix done by Support Team
PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Job failure on CSO JDA batch due to Constraint violation issue
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: Support team excluded the bad records from loading to live table and restarted the job
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. Check the job logs and see if the failure happened due to constraint violation
2. Check for the bad records in bad directory
3. In case of constraint violation, take the necessary backup of the original file  and remove the bad records. 
4.Crete a new file by ignoring the problematic records
5. Ask Ops to restart the job
Remarks: This row is  newly added on 08/21/2024
Remarks_New: This row is  newly added on 08/21/2024

Resolution Categories: Batch Reset With Data Fix done by Support Team
PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Job failure on CSO JDA batch due to data issue
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: Support team used the previous day's file and loaded the data
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. Check the job logs and see any issue with the data like presence of special characters 
2. Check for the bad records in bad directory
3. In case of data issue like special characters, take the necessary backup and remove the bad records. 
4. Insert the previous day's values for the problamatic records 
5. Ask Ops to restart the job

3. Once the nodepools are up, restart the failed job

PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Need to remove JDA access for a planner
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: Application team need to take business approval and then remove access
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. For user access removal request, verify if the necessary details are provided by business if not ask business to provide the same.
2. After the necessary details are received, mail business to seek approval.
3. Once approval is received, login to UI and remove the roles for user and deactivate the user.
4. Send mail to business mentioning that access has been removed.
5. Once business confirm then resolve the ticket.
Remarks: Created on 09/03

Incident Reported (In Remedy): Insufficient information to analyse ordering issues
PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Store Reported missing ordering issue
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: Information provided by the Store is not sufficient, hence mailed store to provide UPC/WICs to analyze further.
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. Send first communication to store to provide UPC/WICs details
2. Send follow up mail to store to provide details.
3. Send Final mail communication to store mentioning to open a new ticket with requested details.
Remarks: Created on 09/05

PROBLEM REPORTED in Resolution Comment: Job failure on CSO JDA batch due to database contention issue
SOLUTION in Resolution Comment(One liner: Connected with the DB team for troubleshooting and restarted the job
Resolution Steps(Detailed steps followed:
1. Connect with BY and DB teams
2. BY team confirmed no data issue and concluded issue is due to DB bottle neck as the query was using the full table scan on SKUEFFIOPARAM
3. DB team applied few solutions like killing the active sessions, rebuilding the index of the SKUEFFIOPARAM , updated the stats of nearly 96 tables and recompiling the invalid objects.
4. Failed instance alone restarted through backend and completed successfully
Remarks: This row is newly added on 11/11
Remarks_New: This row is newly added on 11/12
